company_context: Statista - The Statistics Portal for Market Data, Market Research and Market Studies Skip to main content Order now And get full access to all statistics. Starting from ₹151,980 yearly Empowering people with data Insights and facts across 170 industries and 150+ countries Statista Search Popular topics U.S. tariffs Social media usage E-commerce worldwide Artificial intelligence (AI) Netflix Global inflation TikTok Electric vehicles Sustainability Gaming Trusted by more than 23,000 companies Trusted by more than 23,000 companies Trending statistics Get facts and insights on topics that matter Oct 10, 2025 | Politics & Government Nationality of Nobel Peace Prize laureates 1901-2025 The United States holds the highest number of winners of the Nobel Peace Prize, with 23 winners. The most recent U.S. citizen to win the prize was former President Barack Obama in 2009. The United Kingdom holds the second-highest number of winners with eleven, whereas both Switzerland and UN organizations had received ten each. In 2025, the prize was awarded to the Venezuelan politician and activist Maria Corina Machado for her work promoting democratization in Venezuela. The Nobel Peace Prize is awarded annually to people or organizations who make a substantial commitment to promote peace around the world. Read more Oct 7, 2025 | Population World population by age and region 2024 Globally, about 25 percent of the population is under 15 years of age and 10 percent is over 65 years of age. Africa has the youngest population worldwide. In Sub-Saharan Africa, more than 40 percent of the population is below 15 years, and only three percent are above 65, indicating the low life expectancy in several of the countries. In Europe, on the other hand, a higher share of the population is above 65 years than the population under 15 years. Fertility rates The high share of children and youth in Africa is connected to the high fertility rates on the continent. For instance, South Sudan and Niger have the highest population growth rates globally. However, about 50 percent of the world’s population live in countries with low fertility, where women have less than 2.1 children. Some countries in Europe, like Latvia and Lithuania, have experienced a population decline of one percent, and in the Cook Islands, it is even above two percent. In Europe, the majority of the population was previously working-aged adults with few dependents, but this trend is expected to reverse soon, and it is predicted that by 2050, the older population will outnumber the young in many developed countries. Growing global population As of 2025, there are 8.1 billion people living on the planet, and this is expected to reach more than nine billion before 2040. Moreover, the global population is expected to reach 10 billions around 2060, before slowing and then even falling slightly by 2100. As the population growth rates indicate, a significant share of the population increase will happen in Africa. Read more Oct

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours make better decisions with their data. I came across your company, Statista, and was impressed with the work you're doing in market research and studies. Can I have a few minutes to discuss how our solution can help you?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (sighs) Okay, I'm listening. But make it quick. We're already working with a few data processing vendors, so you'll have to convince me that your solution is worth considering.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Absolutely, I understand. Our solution, DeepData AI, uses machine learning to analyze large datasets and provide actionable insights. We've worked with several companies in the market research space and have seen significant improvements in data quality and processing time. For example, one of our clients was able to reduce their data processing time by 30% and increase their data accuracy by 25%.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: That sounds interesting, but I'm not sure we're in the market for a new data processing solution right now. We just implemented a new system a few months ago, and I'm not convinced that switching to a new vendor would be worth the hassle and cost.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns. However, our solution is designed to be highly integratable with existing systems, so the implementation process is relatively seamless. Additionally, our pricing is competitive, and we offer a flexible pricing model that can be tailored to your specific needs. We've also had success with companies who have switched from other vendors, and we'd be happy to provide case studies and references.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (pauses) Okay, I'll give you a chance to show me what you've got. But I have to warn you, our IT department is very particular about new vendors, and we have a rigorous evaluation process. If you can't demonstrate significant value, we won't be interested.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: That's completely understandable. I'd be happy to schedule a demo and show you how DeepData AI can help Statista. Would you be available for a meeting next Wednesday or Thursday?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (thinks for a moment) Yeah, okay. Let's schedule it for next Wednesday. But like I said, you'll have to convince me that your solution is worth our time and investment.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Great, I'll send over a calendar invite. I'm looking forward to the meeting and demonstrating the value of DeepData AI.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Sounds good. I'll see you then.

analysis.raw:
Score: 7
Outcome: Success
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have asked more questions to understand the buyer's current pain points and system implementation to better tailor the demo and increase the chances of a successful meeting. Sentiment: Neutral
